moves.1. e4: Hi everyone, tea break over and time for a long evening session.  Luckily I manage to overcome fatigue and drive home with 2.5 points already in the bag.
moves.1... c5 2. f4: 2. f4 - this is the Scilian Grand Prix.  I used to experiment with this against the Sicilian a lot in my OTB games.  I played it once on gameknot and was a pawn up against a 1600  player when he timed out on me.
moves.2... d6 3. Nf3 Nc6 4. d4 cxd4 5. Nxd4 Nf: 6. ................... bxc6 - now we have the usual exchange on c6 - as it does not have a good record in the database I have refrained from this exchange since playing on gameknot.
moves.9. Bd3 Bg7 10. f5 O-O 11. O-O Bb7 12. Kh: 12. Kh1 - after both sides complete their development, Henry again sidestepps the possibility of a queen forking check on b6.  Ron decides to centralise his king rook.
moves.12... Rfd8 13. Qd2 Nd7 14. fxg6 fxg6: 14. ............. fxg6 - at last the pawn formation around the black king is disturbed.
moves.15. Bc4+ Kh8 16. Bg5: 16. Bg5 - I wonder whether Rf7 was better here.
moves.16... Ne5 17. Be6 a5 18. Qe3 Ba6 19. Rf2: 19. .................... Ng4?? - overlooks my bishop hiding on e6 and loses a piece.  At least I have taken full advantage here!
moves.20. Bxg4 Rab8 21. Rb1 Rdf8 22. Rxf8+ Rxf: 24. ............... Qxg7 - off come the bishops - I am trying to simplify down to a won endgame.
28. Qb6 - an aggressive move for Glenda the Defender!  The a5 pawn is attacked.
moves.28... d4 29. Na4 Qf7 30. Rf1 Qd5: 30. .............. Qd5?? - threatening Old Matey on g2 but I can take the rook on f8 with check!
37. Rc8 - I am now a whole rook up but my opponent refuses to wave the white flag.  Mind you, again my time management is letting me down, I have 3 moves to make before the time control and I have less than 5 minutes on my clock. It is 40 moves in an hour and a half and then 15 minutes is added on when the time control is met.  Anyone who fails to make 40 moves in an hour and a half or whose flag falls at the end of the 15 minutes added on will forfeit the game on time.
moves.37... Kf6 38. Rc4 Ke5 39. Rc5+ Kd6 40. a: 43. Kf2?? - I quickly centralise my king but overlook the fact that my knight is hanging.  I only just managed to make my 40th move before my flag dropped so I have just under 15 minutes to make all my moves, hence the blunder.
moves.43... Bxa4 44. Ke2 Bc6 45. g3 Be4 46. Kd: 52. Ra6  - this simplification sacrifice will restore material equality but see my note to move 56.
56. Ke6 - and due to the fact that my king could gobble up his pawns before his could gobble up my own, Ron threw in the sponge.  I feel as though I can sleep well tonight knowing I have 2.5 points already in the can.
